headline: Why software stocks face 'a lot' of volatility right now
summary: Monday.com (MNDY) stock is nosediving after the company issued weak third quarter guidance. Meanwhile, software stock investors are closely watching how artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping the sector. Brent Bracelin, Piper Sandler equity research analyst of cloud software and analytics, explains why infrastructure players like Microsoft (MSFT) and Oracle (ORCL) are benefiting first, while application-layer companies face more volatility. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Paramount Stock Falls on UFC Deal. There Could Be More Deals Coming.
summary: Stock in  Paramount Skydance  was down Monday, after the company announced an agreement with  TKO Group Holdings  that will give Paramount exclusive media rights to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S.  Paramount, which is formally called Paramount, a Skydance Corporation, also intends to explore acquiring the rights to UFC outside the U.S. in the future.  As part of the agreement, the Paramount+ streaming platform will show UFC’s full slate of numbered events and ‘Fight Nights,’ with select events simulcast on sister network CBS, the companies said.

headline: 1 Large-Cap Stock on Our Buy List and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: Large-cap stocks have the power to shape entire industries thanks to their size and widespread influence. With such vast footprints, however, finding new areas for growth is much harder than for smaller, more agile players.
